attributes.title: Best of 2020
attributes.description: In our first Gamescast of 2021 we breakdown some of our favorites from 2020 like Hades, Final Fantasy VII Remake, The Last of Us Part 2, Ghost of Tsushima, Spider-Man Miles Morales, Ori and the Will of the Wisps, and more!

attributes.title: Kinda Funny's Game of the Year 2020
attributes.description: THINGS GET SPICY. From Hades, The Last of Us Part 2, Final Fantasy 7 Remake, and Animal Crossing New Horizons all the way to Astro's Playroom and Spider-Man Miles Morales, 2020 was a fantastic year for video games.

attributes.title: Predictions of Metacritic Scores in 2021
attributes.description: We start our 2021 Fantasy Games League! You can join us at http://www.kindafunny.com/gamescastleague

attributes.title: 2021 Video Game Predictions
attributes.description: Tim, Greg, Blessing, and Imran predict video games in 2021 including GTA 6, Zelda, Nintendo Switch Pro, Halo Infinite delays, and more!

attributes.title: The WORST Game of 2021?
attributes.description: Tim, Greg, Blessing, and Imran give impressions on Balan's Wonderland, Super Mario 3D World, Cyber Shadow, and more.

attributes.title: Is Xbox Gamepass The Best Value In Gaming?
attributes.description: Imran's final official Gamescast!

attributes.title: What Games Wouldnâ€™t Work Today?
attributes.description: From Crazy Taxi and Twisted Metal, to SSX and NBA Street, we run through games that might not be as successful in modern times.

attributes.title: Are The Pokemon/Zelda Anniversaries Disappointing?
attributes.description: Imran returns to discuss how we would love to see game anniversaries handled, Greg previews It Takes Two, and Andy gives his honest thoughts on Outriders.

attributes.title: Final Fantasy 14: Why Do People Love It?
attributes.description: GameSpot's Michael Higham travels far to explain to us why Final Fantasy XIV is so dope, and Andy tries to makes us all PC gamers.

attributes.title: It Takes Two Review
attributes.description: Blessing, Greg, and Tim have been playing It Takes Two, and they're ready to review it! Andy is here, too; he's standing.

attributes.title: Outriders Review
attributes.description: We assemble an all-star team to talk about #Outriders. Join -- deep breath -- Greg, Blessing, Andy, SnowBikeMike, Joey, and their very special guests Spawn On Me's Kahlief Adams and the Blind Gamer Steve Saylor to talk about the highs and lows of People Can Fly's looter shooter.

attributes.title: What Is The Snyder Cut of Video Games?
attributes.description: This episode gets weird baby! We talk about alternate versions of Uncharted 4, Metal Gear Solid 5, Bioshock Infinite, and more!

attributes.title: 2021 Games We Are Most Excited For
attributes.description: We rate our hype levels for all the 2021 games that currently have release dates.

attributes.title: New Pokemon Snap Review
attributes.description: It is finally here! Tim and Joey give their thoughts on the New Pokemon Snap on Nintendo Switch and Blessing and Andy talk about all the latest in Apex Legends, Call of Duty Warzone, and Valorant.

attributes.title: Resident Evil Village Review
attributes.description: Brittney Brombacher joins us to review Resident Evil 8.

attributes.title: Predicting Fall 2021 in Video Games
attributes.description: We discuss what we expect to see at E3 and what we really think the holiday season is going to look like on the video game front.

attributes.title: Deathloop Preview
attributes.description: Parris Lilly joins us to give our thoughts on Bethesda's Deathloop and The Ascent.

attributes.title: Biomutant & Knockout City Reviews
attributes.description: SnowBikeMike joins us to review Biomutant and Knockout City.

attributes.title: Official E3 2021 Predictions and Bets
attributes.description: From GTA VI to Breath of the Wild 2 to Mario Kart 9 to Pokemon Legends Arceus to Final Fantasy, to Donkey Kong, here are Kinda Funny's official E3 predictions.

attributes.title: Ratchet and Clank Rift Apart Review
attributes.description: Parris and Joey join Tim, Greg, Blessing, and Andy for their review of Insomniac's latest PlayStation 5 game, Ratchet & Clank Rift Apart.

attributes.title: Tiny Tina's Wonderlands, Elden Ring Recap
attributes.description: Greg, Bless, Andy, and Mike breakdown every announcement from Summer Game Fest Kickoff!

attributes.title: Grading Every E3 Showcase So Far
attributes.description: Tim, Bless, Andy, and Mike grade every E3/Summer Game Fest showcase so far.

attributes.title: Grading Xbox Bethesda & Square-Enix E3 2021 Showcases
attributes.description: Tim, Bless, Andy, Mike, and Greg grade E3 2021 showcases by Xbox Bethesda, Square-Enix, PC Gaming, Future Games, and Back 4 Blood.

attributes.title: Grading Nintendo E3 2021 Showcase
attributes.description: Tim, Greg, Blessing, Andy and Janet grade Nintendo's Direct for E3 2021.

attributes.title: How Wrong Were Our E3 Predictions This Year?
attributes.description: We look back at the winners and losers (SO FAR) of our E3 predictions, discuss Sea of Thieves, Lego Builder Journey, Valorant, and more!

attributes.title: 2021 Games We Are Most Excited For (POST E3 UPDATE!)
attributes.description: Now that E3 is over we have a MUCH better look at the rest of the year, how hyped are we for all the VIDEO GAMES!?!?!?!?!

attributes.title: Xbox's Phil Spencer Joins Us!
attributes.description: We finally sit down with the legendary Phil Spencer to have a great time talking about video games.

attributes.title: Does Metal Gear Solid 1 Still Hold Up?
attributes.description: We give our thoughts on Death's Door and Boomerang X, and then break down if we think Metal Gear Solid 1 still holds up today.

attributes.title: Lost Unreleased Games w/ Raven Simone
attributes.description: Raven Simone AKA Bobdunga joins us to talk GTA 5, Crash Bandicoot 4, Idol Manager, and her hunt for discovering and recovering lost games media.

attributes.title: Tim & Andy's Halo Infinite Impressions w/Danny PeÃ±a
attributes.description: Gamertag Radio's Danny PeÃ±a joins Greg, Tim, Andy, and Bless to talk about Halo Infinite and the crew's most anticipated games of all time!

attributes.title: The Next Big Xbox Exclusive: 12 Minutes
attributes.description: The creator of 12 Minutes joins us to talk about the incredible journey of the game and the video games he has been playing. Also Andy and Blessing gush about Splitgate.

attributes.title: Ghost of Tsushima Directorâ€™s Cut Review
attributes.description: GameSpotâ€™s Lucy James joins Greg, Blessing, and the Xcastâ€™s SnowBikeMike to talk about Ghost of Tsushima Directorâ€™s Cut and 12 Minutes!

attributes.title: Gamescom Opening Night Live 2021 Review and Analysis
attributes.description: From Halo Infinite to Horizon Forbidden West, we breakdown all the announcements from Opening Night Live.

attributes.title: Does Metal Gear Solid 2 Sons of Liberty Still Hold Up?
attributes.description: We give our thoughts on Psychonauts 2, No More Heroes 3, and discuss Barrett's first ever playthrough of MGS2.

attributes.title: Game of the Year: Greg and Tim's Two NEW Different GOTYs
attributes.description: We give our reviews on WarioWare Get It Together, Life Is Strange True Colors, and The Artful Escape. 2 of them are now Greg and Tim's Game of the Years!

attributes.title: Deathloop Review
attributes.description: Greg, Blessing, Janet Garcia, and GameSpot's Tamoor Hussain come together to review Arkane's PS5 exclusive Deathloop.

attributes.title: Marvelâ€™s Guardians of the Galaxy Preview
attributes.description: We give our thoughts on Guardians of the Galaxy, Cruis'n Blast, and Deltarune Chapter 2.

attributes.title: We Predicted 2021 In 2019
attributes.description: Jared Petty returns to talk about ActRaiser, Halo Infinite, New World, and how wrong we were about our Video Game predictions in 2019.

attributes.title: Far Cry 6 Review
attributes.description: Janet, Andy, Mike, and Greg come together to talk about Ubisoft's latest open world Far Cry.

attributes.title: Metroid Dread & Nintendo Switch OLED Review
attributes.description: Tim, Tamoor, and Andy give their thoughts on the Nintendo Switch OLED and Metroid Dread.

attributes.title: Is Metroid Dread Too Hard?
attributes.description: Tim, Tamoor, Andy, and Barrett give their thoughts on Metroid Dread, Back 4 Blood, WarioWare, and more!

attributes.title: Head of Xbox Game Studios Matt Booty Joins Us!
attributes.description: The Head of Xbox Games Studios Matt Booty joins us to talk all about the past, present, and future of Xbox first party titles.

attributes.title: Guardians of the Galaxy Review
attributes.description: Greg Miller makes a brief return to talk to Tim, Blessing, and Mike about their divisive thoughts on Marvel's Guardians of the Galaxy.

attributes.title: Rider's Republic & Mario Party Superstars Reviews
attributes.description: Imran Khan RETURNS to review Rider's Republic and Mario Party Superstars, as well as giving a preview of Shin Megami Tensei V.

attributes.title: We've Played Elden Ring: Our Impressions
attributes.description: Andy Cortez and Tamoor Hussain have PLAYED Elden Ring. Let's dive into their preview and talk about their time with it so far.

attributes.title: Pokemon Brilliant Diamond, Shining Pearl & Halo Infinite MP Impressions
attributes.description: Tim, Andy, and Blessing predict give their thoughts on Pokemon Brilliant Diamond and Shining Pearl and Halo Infinite Multiplayer.

attributes.title: Official Game Awards 2021 Predictions
attributes.description: Tim, Andy, and Blessing predict the winners and losers of The Game Awards 2021 from Deathloop, It Takes Two, Metroid Dread, Returnal, Final Fantasy XIV, Pokemon Unite, and everything in between.

attributes.title: The Last of Us Battle Royale Dreams
attributes.description: Blessing gives his review of Solar Ash and Sancho West joins us to talk about the state of esports, Battle Royales, Halo Infinite, and what he would want from a new The Last of Us Factions.

attributes.title: Halo Infinite Review
attributes.description: Mike and Parris join us to give our thoughts on Halo Infinite's campaign.

attributes.title: Game Awards 2021 Predictions RESULTS!
attributes.description: Mike joins us to go over all of Blessing's Game Awards Adventures and the results of our predictions.
